match.title: 4th ODI
match.statusText: Sri Lanka won by 8 wickets (with 36 balls remaining)

series.name: South Africa tour of Sri Lanka
series.longName: South Africa tour of Sri Lanka

match.hoursInfo: 14.30 start, First Session 14.30-18.00, Interval 18.00-18.45, Second Session 18.45-22.15

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy b Mendis 97 (121b 7x4 2x6 194m) SR: 80.16

dismissalComment.html: it ends on 97 what a pity! Mendis fires in a quick one and Duminy tries another slog - the shot that has fetched him plenty of valuable runs in the last few overs - Mendis really got that leg break to turn sharply, ended up hitting the leg stump, finishes with 4

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Dilshan 77 (71b 9x4 0x6 88m) SR: 108.45

dismissalComment.html: the finger went up immediately! Amla wants to review the lbw, Dilshan was bowling round the wicket, the ball kept low, landed on middle stump, Amla was trapped on the back foot, no sign of an inside edge, Hawkeye showed that crashing on off and middle stumps, plumb

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: through his defenses! Mendis has sent back the dangerous Miller, the legbreak foxed him there, it was quicker and flatter and Miller was forward to defend, didn't read the turn, left a gap between pad and bat

reward for smart captaincy! For the bowling change and field placement. The short leg was placed before Behardien took strike, it was on a good length and he was looking to clip it to the on side, straight off the bat and Thirimanne takes in clean

that was quite plumb! This was the flatter one, straightened after pitching, Morkel was forward to defend but the ball skidded and struck the base of the pads in front of middle, the umpire didn't spend much time mulling over it

it ends on 97 what a pity! Mendis fires in a quick one and Duminy tries another slog - the shot that has fetched him plenty of valuable runs in the last few overs - Mendis really got that leg break to turn sharply, ended up hitting the leg stump, finishes with 4
he gets the yorker this time! Too quick for de Kock, he plays all around it, looks to play across the line, doesn't get the bat down and it hits the base of the middle stump

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: the bottom edge! Malinga bowled him another short one, this one wide outside off stump, Peterson went for the pull  but was a bit too early on the shot, looked ungainly, got the bottom edge and it dipped towards Sangakkara who took it easily in the end

headshotImage.caption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: can SA bat out their 50 overs? This was a slower ball, short as well, Kleinveldt remained in the crease and looked to flat-bat it over the infield, got a top edge that swirled to point where Dilshan took an easy catch jogging forward

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock b Malinga 8 (9b 2x4 0x6 13m) SR: 88.88

dismissalComment.html: he gets the yorker this time! Too quick for de Kock, he plays all around it, looks to play across the line, doesn't get the bat down and it hits the base of the middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla lbw b Dilshan 77 (71b 9x4 0x6 88m) SR: 108.45

dismissalComment.html: the finger went up immediately! Amla wants to review the lbw, Dilshan was bowling round the wicket, the ball kept low, landed on middle stump, Amla was trapped on the back foot, no sign of an inside edge, Hawkeye showed that crashing on off and middle stumps, plumb

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c †Sangakkara b Dilshan 4 (8b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: Dilshan proving to be trump card here for SL! De Villiers took a risk with the paddle sweep and it didn't come off well, Dilshan continues round the wicket to the right-handers, de Villiers shuffles about before delivery to distract the bowler, tries to paddle it and the ball lobs off the face of the bat to the keeper Sanga who was 100% certain de Villiers was gone, the umpire was convinced too

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis st †Sangakkara b Herath 23 (44b 1x4 0x6 49m) SR: 52.27

dismissalComment.html: appeal for a stumping! Faf was lunging forward and beaten on the drive, turn and bounce, his back foot was in the air before dragging it back, Sangakkara got the bails off quickly, replays confirm that his foot was in the air and Faf du Plessis has to go, sharp stumping and good bowling too

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: David Miller b Mendis 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: through his defenses! Mendis has sent back the dangerous Miller, the legbreak foxed him there, it was quicker and flatter and Miller was forward to defend, didn't read the turn, left a gap between pad and bat

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien c Thirimanne b Mendis 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: reward for smart captaincy! For the bowling change and field placement. The short leg was placed before Behardien took strike, it was on a good length and he was looking to clip it to the on side, straight off the bat and Thirimanne takes in clean

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson c †Sangakkara b Malinga 13 (15b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 86.66

dismissalComment.html: the bottom edge! Malinga bowled him another short one, this one wide outside off stump, Peterson went for the pull  but was a bit too early on the shot, looked ungainly, got the bottom edge and it dipped towards Sangakkara who took it easily in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Rory Kleinveldt c Dilshan b Malinga 8 (10b 0x4 1x6 12m) SR: 80

dismissalComment.html: can SA bat out their 50 overs? This was a slower ball, short as well, Kleinveldt remained in the crease and looked to flat-bat it over the infield, got a top edge that swirled to point where Dilshan took an easy catch jogging forward

headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Morne Morkel lbw b Mendis 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: that was quite plumb! This was the flatter one, straightened after pitching, Morkel was forward to defend but the ball skidded and struck the base of the pads in front of middle, the umpire didn't spend much time mulling over it

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 115 (130b 16x4 0x6 192m) SR: 88.46

headshotImage.caption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Kleinveldt b Morkel 91 (101b 8x4 2x6 134m) SR: 90.09

dismissalComment.html: we won't see twin hundreds today! Morkel pitched it up further and Sangakkara went on his knee to smash it straight, gets a top edge and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-off and takes the catch
we won't see twin hundreds today! Morkel pitched it up further and Sangakkara went on his knee to smash it straight, gets a top edge and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-off and takes the catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch and good field placement too! Tsostobe gets it to angle across and gets some extra bounce, Jayawardene tries to run it square of the wicket towards third man but Amla was stationed at gully, it traveled quickly and he did well to fall to his left and take the catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Amla b Tsotsobe 12 (26b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 46.15

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch and good field placement too! Tsostobe gets it to angle across and gets some extra bounce, Jayawardene tries to run it square of the wicket towards third man but Amla was stationed at gully, it traveled quickly and he did well to fall to his left and take the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Kleinveldt b Morkel 91 (101b 8x4 2x6 134m) SR: 90.09

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: Dilshan seals a crushing win! Clipped off his pads to square leg and fitting Dilshan does the honours and Sri Lanka are 3-1 up and cannot lose the series

commentPostTextItems.html: Dilshan is the Man of the Match: "I took a lot of confidence from my bowling. Amla's wicket was very important for us, and we bowled really well after that. The plan was to see off the first few overs, rotate strike and then take chances. Scoring 30s and 40s no point for me or the team."

AB: "No doubt we were 30 runs short. Great knock there by JP. Middle order didn't get going. The pitch turned a bit more today. Credit to Sanga and Dilshan. I asked JP what he thought about the lbw appeal against Sanga and he didn't look confident, thought it was missing leg. The boys have fought hard. I thought de Kock handled himself well so far."

Mathews: "Was a bit worried after I lost the toss, they started well. We did well to hold them back. We wanted to keep them to under 250. I wanted to use Mendis more at the latter part when the wicket has been slower. Not sure if we will experiment in the final game. We would want to beat them 4-1."
That's it from us here. Thanks for your company. More reading material on this game coming up from Andrew Fernando. We'll see you soon. Cheers!

End of match: 238 was thought of as a challenging score at the break, but the seniors, Sanga and Dilshan made it seem as if SA were at least 50 short. A lot went wrong for South Africa in both innings. They couldn't sneak in early wickets like they did the last match, and normally, when Dilshan bats through, Sri Lanka are relatively safe. Perhaps today would have been good to send in either Thirimanne or Chandimal at No.3, but for the sake of closing out the series, they went with the experienced and in-form Sanga. They can do so for the final game, which is a dead rubber.

Leehar: "Still, you can see what South Africa have been missing. Brought Amla back, the start improved. Bring Kallis back and stability will come into the middle order. Bring Steyn in, and the killer instinct will come in for the Bowlers. All the ingredients are there, just need to make the right recipe."

commentTextItems.html: fires this one short down the leg side and he swivels and pulls to fine leg
fires this one wide outside the off stump and Thirimanne doesn't offer a shot
this was fractionally short and he pulled in front of square, the fielder just pulls back before the rope, the umpire checks
full on the pads and he clips this one to square leg
everything going Dilshan's way, not too short to pull and yet he gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps
defends forward and we have a maiden over in the midst of the carnage
opportunity there, he dropped this shorter and Thirimanne rocked back and ended up punching to short cover
quicker one and comes forward and defends
shapes to cut but finds point
gets forward and drives straight to mid-off
quicker delivery and he gets forward and defends
gets one to straighten and beat the outside edge, too bad Morkel didn't bowl too many of those today
stays back and punches it to the off side
he strays wide down the leg side

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Kleinveldt b Morkel 91 (101b 8x4 2x6 134m) SR: 90.09

commentTextItems.html: we won't see twin hundreds today! Morkel pitched it up further and Sangakkara went on his knee to smash it straight, gets a top edge and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-off and takes the catch

commentPostTextItems.html: Fantastic series so far for Sanga, In line for the Man of the Series

commentTextItems.html: too wide outside off and penalised
91 now, length ball outside off and Sanga thuds it down the ground down to long-off
Sanga makes room and walks across his stumps and unfortunately for him it strikes the pad and rolls to the on side
his intent is clear, Morkel bowls length outside off, mid-off is up, Sanga makes room and smacks it over the off side and down to wide long-on

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy b Mendis 97 (121b 7x4 2x6 194m) SR: 80.16

dismissalComment.html: it ends on 97 what a pity! Mendis fires in a quick one and Duminy tries another slog - the shot that has fetched him plenty of valuable runs in the last few overs - Mendis really got that leg break to turn sharply, ended up hitting the leg stump, finishes with 4

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan not out 115 (130b 16x4 0x6 192m) SR: 88.46

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Amla b Tsotsobe 12 (26b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 46.15

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch and good field placement too! Tsostobe gets it to angle across and gets some extra bounce, Jayawardene tries to run it square of the wicket towards third man but Amla was stationed at gully, it traveled quickly and he did well to fall to his left and take the catch

headshotImage.caption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rory Kleinveldt player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Kleinveldt b Morkel 91 (101b 8x4 2x6 134m) SR: 90.09

dismissalComment.html: we won't see twin hundreds today! Morkel pitched it up further and Sangakkara went on his knee to smash it straight, gets a top edge and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-off and takes the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne not out 1 (8b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 12.5

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 91 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: Pitch played on our minds - de Villiers
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Pitch played on our minds - AB de Villiers
stories.summary: Hashim Amla's departure hastened a collapse which both he and AB de Villiers marked as the defining moment of the match

image.caption: Hashim Amla drives the ball through the covers
image.longCaption: Hashim Amla drives the ball through the covers, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele, July 28, 2013

stories.title: New routine brings Dilshan relief
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: There is unbridled joy in each of Tillakaratne Dilshan's hundred celebrations, but this one was tinged with some relief too. He is arriving at a period in his career where he must prove even to himself that his skill remains undimmed

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan leaps for joy on reaching his century
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan leaps for joy on reaching his century, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele, July 28, 2013

stories.title: Dilshan's would-be wide
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Plays of the day: Dilshan's would-be wide
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the fourth ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan picked up two quick wickets
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan picked up two quick wickets, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele, July 28, 2013

stories.title: Dilshan, Sangakkara secure series
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: An unbeaten century from Tillakaratne Dilshan and 91 from Kumar Sangakkara carried Sri Lanka to a series win over South Africa with one match to play

image.caption: Tillakaratne Dilshan set to drive the ball
image.longCaption: Tillakaratne Dilshan set to drive the ball, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele, July 28, 2013

stories.title: Hosts seek to arrest South Africa's momentum
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 4th ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Hosts seek to arrest South Africa's momentum
stories.summary: After South Africa asserted some control over their fate in Sri Lanka, on what was perhaps the driest pitch of the tour to date, it has now fallen to the hosts to arrest the momentum their opponents have gleaned from a big victory
stories.byline: The Preview by Andrew Fidel Fernando in Pallekele

image.caption: Thisara Perera ready to muscle the ball over the top
image.longCaption: Thisara Perera ready to muscle the ball over the top, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013
